alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 3:12PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Rivers draining the Brooks Range in the Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...Through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt has caused rivers draining from the southeastern Brooks Range to rise to near bankfull in many locations, with water over banks in some low lying areas. River levels will continue to rise in Allakaket and Hughes through tomorrow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain has fallen on existing snowpack leading to increased runoff. Flows in rivers may increase quickly covering gravel bars. An increased amount of debris will flow down rivers. Minor flooding is possible in Hughes and Allakaket. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood Those living or recreating along rivers draining the Brooks Range are encouraged to monitor river levels this weekend.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
